sentences.sContent: The house was near a park but there was a road in between.
sentences.sCn: 房子在一处公园附近，但两者之间隔着一条马路。

sentences.sContent: I see her most weekends but not very often in between.
sentences.sCn: 我周末大多都能见到她，但平时不常见到。

sentences.sContent: ...middle-class families earning between $30,000 and $75,000 a year fell right between working-class and high-earning parents...
...The increasing differences in child rearing between rich and poor families reflect growing social inequality...
...there has been a heated discussion as to a better choice between attending college at home and abroad...
...there was a clear divide between large and small cities...
...we boost opportunity for fulfilling understanding between each other...
...Many scientists disagree about what the differences are between an alcohol addict and a social drinker...
...some indicator which would rate the wealth of nations in both economic and environmental terms and show a relationship between the two...
...The common theme of the UN reports is the relation between environmental protection and economic growth...
...Terrie Moffitt's paper on the link between childhood self-control and adult status decades later is published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences...

phrases.pCn: 只限于咱俩之间；我们之间的秘密
只限于咱们之间；秘密的

trans.tranOther: in the space or period of time separating two or more points, objects, etc. or two dates, events, etc.
